headline: Coconut Curry Butternut Squash Soup
description: Roasted butternut squash is simmered with curry, coconut milk, and a hint of spice in this warm and comforting soup perfect for weeknights.
name: Coconut Curry Butternut Squash Soup
recipeIngredient: 2.5 cups vegetable stock, or more if needed
1 pinch freshly grated nutmeg, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Place butternut squash in a baking dish, flesh side up. Brush 1 tablespoon melted butter over the flesh and top with 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, and cayenne pepper.
Roast in the preheated oven until tender, about 1 hour. Remove squash from oven and cool for 15 minutes.

Place a large stockpot over medium heat; add 1 tablespoon butter. Cook and stir onion in the melted butter for 2 minutes. Add curry powder; cook and stir for 1 minute. Stir in coconut milk; bring to a boil.

Scoop flesh from the butternut squash and add to coconut milk mixture; mix in remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, vegetable stock, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until soup is heated through.
Blend soup using an immersion blender on low speed. Simmer until soup is smooth and thickened, about 20 minutes more. Add more vegetable stock for a thinner consistency and season with salt.
Ladle soup into bowls and top each with pumpkin seeds and a pinch of nutmeg.

review.reviewBody: Delicious, rich and creamy tasting!
Excellent flavor. Roasted squash seeds for garnish.

This soup is amazingly good. I'm just about to make for the 3rd time so I was going over the ingredients. It calls for pumpkin seeds - I've not used them previously BUT, I noticed that the instructions don't include the pumpkin seeds??

Some effort required but doing so produced outstanding flavor and texture. The recipe was easy to follow once you get passed prepping the butternut squash. Absolutely delicious! This recipe will definitely be used again. Thanks!
Fast and easy with a frozen bag of squash. Make again!

The start of this recipe could easily be an amazing side dish! In fact, the roasted, sweet & spicy squash almost never made it to my pot for the soup in which I was making! So good! However! This soup is amazing! Made as is but doubled the yellow curry and added some ginger. I did need to thin this quite a bit - needing more liquids (my guess is too much squash) but the result was still a new favorite. Thanks Mint&Mangoes for sharing this awesome and mostly easy recipe
So yummy! I only used 2 cups of vegetable broth
It has a bit of kick, but lovely taste
Wonderful sweet and savory hint of spice hearty tummy warming soup. Great way to use left over winter squash. I grow Kabacha Sunshine which is perfect for this soup.
I reduced the amount of broth to make it thicker. Very good!

Very pleasing! I used previously-roasted butternut squash cubes (20-30 min at 430 degrees), and I used almond milk (vanilla unsweetened) instead of coconut milk. Next time, I will add ginger at the beginning also. Really good!
My new favorite soup. Amazing flavor! Made with no changes to recipe. Thanks for this great recipe!!
I made this fir a family party and it was an absolute hit!! Everyone loved it and I got tons of compliments. Will be making again. I followed the recipe exactly.

This was delicious! Instead of butternut squash I used Red Kuri squash (a new one to me). I didn’t put the cayenne in the soup because not everyone in my house likes spice, but I sprinkled it on my bowl and it was great. Nice combo of sweet, salty, savory and spicy. I would serve this at Thanksgiving, Christmas, or any chilly day. YUM
Oh. My. Gosh.This is a delicious recipe! I wasn't real sure if I'd like it. I used coconut milk. The yummy thick kind. Mmm Mmm! Served it worth garlic bread. Perfect cool weather meal!
This is the best soup I have made in a long time. Even my sister who does not like curry enjoyed this soup. The BEST!
As others have done, I added about a tablespoon of fresh minced ginger root when the onions are close to done.

Fabulous! Highly recommend. We love spices so instead of 1 tsp of curry we like 2 tsp. We also added a little fresh ginger and a touch of honey to taste. You can use allspice in place of pumpkin pie spice.

Very easy recipe that came out super creamy which I didn’t expect after adding the vegetable broth. I did season to my taste. This was a great use of the butternut squash from my garden. I’ll definitely make this again.
Excellent as is. Love the little bit of zip that the cayenne pepper adds. My new favorite butternut squash soup recipe.
This is scrumptious! The butternut squash is a joy to smell while it is baking and you can refrigerate it to put the soup together another day if timing is an issue. Will become a staple!
Loved it, gourmet soup anyone can make.

I have made this twice and it is very simple and good. The first time I made it as written and added a little more spice and skipped the immersion blender. The second time I used pumpkin smoked on the grill and a little more seasoning. Good both times. Will make again
I thought it was really good....I added a 1/2 tsp cayenne and it brought it up to just the right level of heat, but my wife said I could have left it out. I even got some pepitos for garnish.
Great recipe...I made this recipe for a soup-cook-off and was voted as People's Choice.
Made just as published, love it! Will make it again.
This is a great dairy free recipe. It had plenty of flavor. I used chicken stock vs. vegetable and you couldn't tell the difference. I would definitely make this again!!
Absolutely delish. I’ve made it twice. Family keeps asking for it. I added 1 carrot, 1 celery, 1 apple, fresh ginger and 2 T of maple syrup.
Delicious! I made it exactly as written (except I didn't top it with the pepitas) and I wouldn't change a thing. This will become a winter staple.

I baked a red Kuri squash and pureed it before I sautéed onion, garlic, 1 chopped apple, 1 celery, thai yellow curry paste (about 1/4 cup) and 3/4 t of pumpkin pie spice and 1/4 t cayenne and a few grinds of black pepper. Added the coconut milk last. Delicious!
Best Butternut Squash Soup recipe! Perfect balance of sweet and subtle spice. Everyone loves this soup. Warms me up on a chilly day! ??

Excellent! I will be making this one over and over again. I didn't roast the butternut squash in the oven, I used the microwave instead since I didn't have an hour and don't feel like there's a big difference in taste. there only actual taste change I made is to add two tablespoons of sugar since I like my squash a little sweet. I love Panera's Autumn Squash soup, but this is even better. I served it with toasted Rosemary bread. So tasty and satisfying.
Super recipe!
4.5 Stars. We grow butternut squash and are always looking for new ways to make it. This was great, but I think we added lots of black pepper and ground red pepper to spice it up a little.

Used 3 teaspoon red curry paste instead of yellow curry powder.
I did not add any nutmeg or pumpkin seeds.

Absolutely love this!

Very nice, and easy recipe. I only gave 4 stars, as I used our leftover Thanksgiving squash, so it was boiled and not roasted. I think that took away from the flavor, a bit. (Not the fault of the recipe!) I did add some fresh ginger and a bit of extra curry to spice it up a bit.
So good, made it exactly as written! Just the right amount of spices and the coconut milk pairs great with the squash. A keeper

I made it just the way the recipe said. If I did it again I would add some ginger, I think. But I did it because I had lots of squash and wanted to try it that way. My husband didn't like it, but I didn't think he would as he doesn't really like that type of soup.
This is an excellent soup! Very tasty! The coconut milk adds a hint of sweetness and great texture. Thank you.
This will be a staple in my house! I made it with pumpkin instead of butternut squash, and I added 2 tablespoons of peanut butter. It was fantastic.
Delicious and although well spiced, I added a small amount of red curry paste for added zip!

Let you in on a little secret I discovered while making this soup....if you did nothing but follow the first 3 steps of this recipe, you would have a delicious side dish of butternut squash to serve with any meat. When I tasted the squash after coming out of the oven, I could have stopped right then and there!! But...I wanted to try this soup in it's entirety and so glad I did. We loved it. Except for adding some ginger and allspice I kept every thing else the same. Thanks so much, Mint and Mangos, for a great soup/side dish (2 in 1) recipe!!
Super easy and delicious! I used frozen cooked butternut squash instead of baking my own. I put all the spices in at once when I added the squash to the milk mixture.
Seriously simple (and I don’t cook a lot) and came out great! Had made it to take to work with me but I already ate it all so will have to make another batch! Thanks!
this was one of the best I have ever made. I made it with the same ingredients but I microwaved the squash. It was delicious.
Great recipe.....we all loved it!!!
Amazing!
First time trying curry powder and my family loves this soup! Making a new batch today as it stores well in the freezer.

I did this in my electric pressure cooker. I first peeled and removed the seeds from the butternut squash and quartered it. I cooked it in 1 cup of chicken broth for 12 minutes and allowed to naturally release pressure.While it was doing this I sauted the onion in a frying pan with 2 tsp of butter for 3 minutes added the curry powder and continued for 1 minute then added a can of lite coconut milk and brought this to a simmer.I then added the contents of the frying pan to my pressure cooker containing the squash,added another cup of chicken broth as well as the seasonings and turned on my pressure cookerfor another 2 minutes and allowed it to naturally release pressure when the time was up.I chose not to blend it and it was delicious!!

I absolutely LOVE this recipe! I’ve been making this consistently in the fall and winters now and my partner requests it. It’s the only squash soup recipe I’ve ever tried and I don’t plan on changing! It’s got a great bit of heat and love using coconut milk since I’m lactose intolerant. Absolutely great dish.
I didn't have a big enough Butternut Squash, so I added some Red Kabocha Squash. I pureed it in a Vitamix and this recipe made the most velvety, tasty soup. I will definitely make again.

This soup is very flavorful and nicely spicy. I saved a bit of work by using 2 lb of already-chunked butternut squash. I coated the chunks with the spices/butter indicated in the recipe, and the roasting time was much shorter. Also, lacking pepitas, we garnished with roasted sunflower seeds, and that was tasty.

This soup was amazing! First time making squash soup. I had an abundance of butternut squash from my garden this year and I am glad I decided to try this recipe! I did not add the extra nutmeg as we are not huge fans of it. I thought the amount in the pumpkin pie spice was perfect. I roasted the squash seeds and put those on top of the soup. We had spinach, apple, onion and sharp cheddar grilled cheese with it. Delicious!
Needs to be a bit more spicy. Also, adding some potato would make it a bit more filling and less sweet.
this recipe was easy to follow and is absolutely delicious!
I've made this delicious soup quite a few times and let me tell you it is a hit with my family! No changes, no substitutions, no deletions. You won't be disappointed!
Added spaghetti squash, acorn squash, zucchini and pumpkin as well as the butternut squash.
I liked it, family thought it was missing something .
Delicious!!
Made exactly as written...my husband loved it so much that I'm making it again this week. The flavours were outstanding. Thank you for a great recipe!
Made the recipe just as published and it is wonderful. Will make it again!
I used acorn squash and chicken stock, my hubby doesn’t like nutmeg so left that out... it was yummy. The pumpkin seeds really made the dish for me

This is a great recipe. Can add enhancements as you like, but also good as is. I even like to add half of an apple!!! 
For a short cut, I buy the already bagged, chopped butternut squash, microwave it, and the soup is done in no time!
I added ground ginger as well
Added 1tsp minced garlic when I sautéed the onion and a little cinnamon because we love
Followed the recipe with no changes and it was great. I will be making it again very soon as we loved it.
First time and I will do again and again....curry, nutmeg,cinnamon go perfect. I tried this also with sweet potatoes.
This is the best recipe for butternut squash soup ever! It was a huge hit everyone loved it. The only change I made was to add about 2 tablespoons of fresh grated ginger. Amazing!
I made it with the left over squash we had in the fridge which was just about the same quantity. Delicious!

I made this vegan and low FODMAP with these changes:
* Coconut oil instead of butter
* Vegetable broth instead of chicken
* No onion
* I added 1/4 C lemon juice
I just roasted my squash whole for an hour, peeled/pureed it with veg broth and tossed everything together in the electric pressure cooker for an hour. YUM!
This is a rich and tasty soup. I chose to pre-microwave the squash for 9 minutes which made it easier to peel, then I followed the recipe adjusting the oven time.

YUM! I cooked the squash (I used Kabocha), the day before so putting it all together was a breeze. We don't like nutmeg so I sub cinnamon and turmeric instead YUM!!!! Used low fat coconut milk so not to naughty .thank you for this fabulous fall soup

This was very good! I added some shredded carrots, (from the freezer, needed to use them up). I also added about 3/4 tsp fresh ginger, pinch each of paprika, coriander and black pepper and a tsp.of red curry paste. Will definitely make it again!
really good! I added just a bit of milk at the end to make it a little creamier but it was great without it too
Easy to make and delicious exactly as written (except that where I live, coconut milk comes in 14 oz cans). The immersion blender made it a nice, smooth texture.

Skipped the butter and salt at the squash baking stage, simply seasoning with the pumpkin seasoning before placing in the oven. Followed the rest of the recipe entirely and it was excellent - a definite keeper!
Delicious! Will make this one again for sure.
This is an interesting tasting soup, quite filling too. I used coconut oil instead of butter. Thank you for the recipe.
